Add/Replace/Delete.Description: The ADD/Delete/Replace modifiers are used in a definition to Add/Delete/Replace an attribute to the Definition.
Add/Replace/Delete.Name: Add/Replace/Delete

Auto.Description: This attribute is used to tell the system that it is a specialized report which does not instantiate its own variables and objects. It also does not bring the confirmation box 'Accept' when the report is accepted.
Auto.Name: Auto

Belongs To.Description: By specifying the 'Family' name for a report, the same report can be given access for the users through security control. Once we give the family name for a report, it appears in the reports list in security control. The same family name can be given for the same category of reports.
Belongs To.Name: Belongs To

Collection.Description: Majorly used for printing directly from the menu, the collection name is the primary collection on which the report will repeat. And the method name is the next level sub collections method.
Collection.Name: Collection

Column Report.Description: It is used in case of multicolumnar reports. Report Name specified with this attribute is executed when the New Column button is activated.
Column Report.Name: Column Report

Column Var.Description: This attribute lists out the variables based on which the multi-columns values are repeated. This is introduced mainly to support columnar reports in remote.
Column Var.Name: Column Var

Config.Description: This attribute specifies the configuration report name when the configuration action does not have a report name as a parameter.
Config.Name: Config

Copies.Description: The number of Copies to be printed can be set with this attribute.  The default value is one for all the forms, under a report.
Copies.Name: Copies

Dashboard Report Type.Description: This attribute specifies whether the report is of dashboard type or not.
Dashboard Report Type.Name: Dashboard Report Type

Date Picker Type.Description: To specify the date picker type in the browser report. For example, Range, Date or None. If it is set to Range, it impacts SVFromDate and SVTodate. If it is set to a day, it impacts SVCurrentdate.
Date Picker Type.Name: Date Picker Type

Default Tile.Description: This attribute is used to list the collection of tiles that need to be part of the original view of the Dashboard.
Default Tile.Name: Default Tile

Empty.Description: This attribute decides whether the forms attached to the report will be printed or not. This is used in multi printing reports.
Empty.Name: Empty

Export.Description: It determines whether the current report is exportable or not.
Export.Name: Export

Export Header.Description: Export header is used to specify the header info for the XML when a Report is being posted as an XML either as a Request Report or Pre Request Report.
Export Header.Name: Export Header

Fetch Collection.Description: This attribute is used when the same collection is used in the report either for repeating the line over its objects or multiple functions using the same, then a collection of those objects can be pre fetched at the report level using Fetch Collection. This is useful in case of remote access since the data has to come from the server and the client need not send the request again and again.
Fetch Collection.Name: Fetch Collection

Fetch Object.Description: This attribute is used when multple methods of a single object is required for a report, then that object can be fetched at report level using Fetch Object. This is useful in case of remote access since the data has to come from the server and the client need not send the request again and again.
Fetch Object.Name: Fetch Object

Fetch Values.Description: This attribute allows the computation of user defined methods based on the current object Context.
Fetch Values.Name: Fetch Values

Filter.Description: The Filtered attribute is used to filter non-group companies from Group companies and is applicable only for a non-group company.
Filter.Name: Filter

Form.Description: The Form attribute defines a form or set of forms associated with the report.
Form.Name: Form

Full Screen.Description: It helps to control the display of command window/calculator pane. Full screen displays the report in the full screen.
Full Screen.Name: Full Screen

Goto Subtitle.Description: The subtitle of the Report to be specified along with Goto Title in Goto Report lists.
Goto Subtitle.Name: Goto Subtitle

Goto Title.Description: The title of Report to be used in Goto Report lists. If not specified, Title will be used.
Goto Title.Name: Goto Title

Help.Description: This attribute takes the System formula which in turn has a Help ID or the Help id as its parameter, the id connects the report with a particular help file.
Help.Name: Help

Inheritable Collection.Description: This attribute specifies the name of the collections which can be inherited by the child collections.
Inheritable Collection.Name: Inheritable Collection

Is ODBC Table.Description: Attribute to determine if the table should be shown or not when messagebox opens.
Is ODBC Table.Name: Is ODBC Table

Keep Xml Case.Description: By setting KeepXmlCase attribute Yes, the program will not convert to upper case automatically while exporting but will keep/preserve the case as specified by the programmer.
Keep Xml Case.Name: Keep Xml Case

List.Description: ListName is an attribute used in the report definition that will accept the name of the report. Later the same report name will be shown in 'Select Report' table list. If the list name is not given for a particular report, it takes the report name itself in the 'Select Report'.
List.Name: List

List Var.Description: It is similar to the variable definition except that List variable can hold array of same variables values. A variable at the declaration time can be either declared as a single instance or a list by using a List Variable declaration attribute.
List Var.Name: List Var

Local.Description: The Local attribute is used in the context of the definition to set local value within the scope of that definition only.
Local.Name: Local

MultiObjects.Description: This attribute is required to be specified in case multiple objects of the same collection are being modified in the Report.
MultiObjects.Name: MultiObjects

Object.Description: To specify the Object associated with the Report.
Object.Name: Object

On.Description: ON keyword is used to specify a list of Actions to be executed on the occurance of an Event.
On.Name: On

Option.Description: Option is an attribute which can be used by various definitions, to provide a conditional result in a program.
Option.Name: Option

Output Config Report.Description: Report Name specified with this attribute gets executed when the Print button is activated.This is used to get the inputs from the user for the priting configuration and sets the variable. Later the same will be used in the printing of the base report.
Output Config Report.Name: Output Config Report

Output Pre Config Report.Description: This attribute is used to get the inputs from the user for the printing configuration and sets the variable for printing the base report.
Output Pre Config Report.Name: Output Pre Config Report

Plain JSON.Description: Set the value of this attribute to Yes to create a JSON/XML file without any content formatting (such as indents and new lines). The default value is No.

Meta.Aliases: Plain JSON, Plain Output, Plain Xml

Plain JSON.Name: Plain JSON

Precheck.Description: This attribute helps to check a condition before launching the report. If the condition satisfies the report is launched else specified query is displayed for resolution of the failed condition.
Precheck.Name: Precheck

PreFetch Object.Description: At the report level the Set attribute for changing variable value takes precedence and Fetch Object is evaluated later. In this case fetching the object first becomes mandatory. For this purpose Pre Fetch Object can be used which will be evaluated before.
PreFetch Object.Name: PreFetch Object

PreLoad Control.Description: This attribute is used to open a message box with a message and prevent opening the report if the first parameter is true.
PreLoad Control.Name: PreLoad Control

Print Set.Description: This is used to set the value to the variable for the report, only in print action/mode
Print Set.Name: Print Set

Repeat.Description: The repeat variables can hold multiple value of the same type. These values can be accessed via an implicit index framework from the field, when field is repeated. Repeat variables are supported only in report scope for the purpose of the column reports. These variables can be filled using a collection and method specification in the variable.
Repeat.Name: Repeat

Set.Description: This attribute initializes the value of the variable for the report.
Set.Name: Set

Skip Value Filter.Description: This attribute is used to skip the value filter when inheriting from a report where value filter is applied.
Skip Value Filter.Name: Skip Value Filter

Stripe.Description: This attribute enables (Yes) /disables (No) Stripes for the report to improve readability. By default it'll be set as Yes and specific format of data will have Stripes enabled. The behavior can be overridden by usage of same attribute in the child (Form).
Stripe.Name: Stripe

Switch.Description: 'Switch' attribute is similar to the Option attribute but reduces code complexity and improves the performance. The Switch are grouped using a label Once a condition is satisfied from one group, switch won't  check further conditions from the same group.  It will evaluate the conditions from the other groups specified, if any.
Switch.Name: Switch

Title.Description: It displays the title for the report in the left top corner.
Title.Name: Title

Trigger.Description: Primarily used to enhance the user-friendliness of Tally and always associated with a key combination.  A trigger comes into effect when a pre-defined combination of keys is pressed to obtain a desired result. It is used to fill the information from SubForm.
Trigger.Name: Trigger

Unique.Description: This attribute determines whether each instance of the report is unique which helps in evaluation of PrintSet of each instance.
Unique.Name: Unique

Update TopReport.Description: Refresh Only the Active report. During drilldown only the top most report should refresh unless pressed escape
Update TopReport.Name: Update TopReport

Use.Description: The USE keyword is used in a definition to reuse an existing definition.
Use.Name: Use

Variable.Description: Used to declare the variables at the report level.This variable is available to this report and all its child reports and functions.
Variable.Name: Variable
